title: Facebook's 3rd Act Will Be Monumental
text: Facebook's change of its product strategy to a privacy-focused platform will have seismic impacts on its business model.

title: Facebook Stock Falls After Wall Street Downgrade Raises Concerns
text: The financial impact of Facebook's strategic pivot toward privacy and encrypted messages, and the growing risks of regulation, are among the reasons Facebook's valuation will decline.

title: Facebook defends itself in Cambridge Analytica consumer class-action case
text: New courts papers counter plaintiffs who say they’ve been wronged in the information sharing firestorm.

title: Tech giants scramble to find solutions for violent video
text: Mobile Nations senior editor Russell Holly and Cybersponse Founder Joseph Loomis on whether social media giants will be able to remove all of the footage from the New Zealand massacre and if Google's aid to China damaging for the US.

title: Facebook faces backlash over leadership shake-up, stock downgraded
text: Dan Howley of Yahoo Finance reports on Needham's decision to  downgrade Facebook citing regulatory risks.

title: Facebook stock has worst day of 2019 after executive exodus, investigations and downgrade
text: Facebook is down about 13 percent over the past year and has fallen three straight days.

title: This Just In: Facebook Stock Downgraded
text: A lot of executives are heading for the exits at Facebook. Should you do likewise?

title: The FAANG Trade In Focus Again
text: Since the equity market peak in the third quarter of 2018, the average return of the FAANG basket of stocks, has underperformed the broader S&P 500 Index as seen below.

title: There will be reckoning for tech companies, says Mississippi Attorney General
text: Jim Hood, Mississippi attorney general, and CNBC's Jon Fortt join 'The Exchange' to discuss state AGs suing tech companies over antitrust issues.

title: Pressure on tech companies immense and likely to continue, says expert
text: Tony Romm of The Washington Post and CNBC's Jon Fortt join 'The Exchange' to discuss state attorneys general calling for the regulation of tech giants.

title: Facebook cut to hold from buy at Needham
text: The Halftime Report traders debate Needham's call to downgrade Facebook to hold from buy

title: New Zealand shooting spurs debate over live streams
text: Tech analyst Blake Harris on the mounting debate over live streams in the wake of the mass shooting in New Zealand.

title: Louisiana Attorney General Jeff Landry on breaking up big tech
text: Louisiana Attorney General Jeff Landry joins "Squawk Alley" to discuss mounting calls to break up some of the biggest tech names like Google, Facebook and Apple.

title: The Ratings Game: Facebook stock falls as worry of ‘negative network effects’ prompts downgrade
text: Shares of Facebook fall toward a third straight loss after Needham analyst Laura Martin downgrades the social-media giant, citing concerns that “negative network effects” could speed up the destruction of value for investors.

title: Needham: Facebook No Longer A Buy Amid A 'Negative Network Effect'
text: The bullish case for Facebook, Inc. stock has come to an end, according to Needham.

title: Why this expert agrees that some tech companies should be broken up
text: Mark May, senior internet analyst at Citi, and Laura Martin, senior analyst at Needham, join "Squawk Alley" to examine some of the biggest tech stocks.

title: Kara Swisher on Facebook's 'biblically bad week'
text: Recode co-founder Kara Swisher joins "Squawk Alley" to talk about her new op-ed in the New York Times in which she breaks down another week of controversy for Facebook.

title: Facebook, YouTube and Twitter caught in a game of whack-a-mole to delete mosque shooting videos
text: Facebook said it removed 1.5 million videos of the mosque attack in New Zealand in the first 24 hours after the original was posted.

title: Bank Of America Lowers Facebook Price Target, Remains 'Constructive' On The Stock
text: Facebook, Inc. CEO Mark Zuckerberg's vision for the future of the social media platform prompted BofA to turn less bullish on the stock.

title: Facebook Is Working to Become a Safer Place
text: The social media site has new detection technology for finding non-consensual intimate images.
